bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to William F. Wharton
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, November 22nd 1889.

Mr. Ezekiel E. Smith
To the Department of State.
Subject:
Public Debt, Currency, Receipts and Expenditures of Liberia.

Consulate General of the United States,
Monrovia, Liberia, November 22nd 1889.

Honorable William F Wharton,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington, D.C.
Sir:

I have the honor respectfully to transmit herewith a meager statement concerning the public debt, currency, receipts, and expenditures of Liberia, as furnished this Consulate General by the Secretary of State of Liberia.

The Circular was handed said officer on the 17th of September; and, at the time, a request was made that the information desired be furnished as soon as practicable. The gentleman's attention having been repeatedly called to the same, it was returned to this office on the 17th inst with the within enclosure.

I am, sir, your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith.
U.S. Consul General.
Enclosures, two.

1. Statement concerning the Public Debt &c
2. Mr Barclay to Mr. Smith (copy)

Department of State,
Monrovia, November 16th 1889
Sir.
I have the honor to acknowledge the receipt of your No. 9 of the 12th inst and to enclose herewith the Circular referred to in said communication.

2. I am informed by the Department of the Treasury that by reason of unavoidable circumstances, it is presently impossible to render the statement of receipts, expenditures, interest, charges &c encouched in the said Circular.

I have the honor to be,
sir,
Your obedient servant,
(Signed) E. J. Barclay
div1.fw:
Hon E. E. Smith
U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General,
Monrovia.

div1.p:
Statement Concerning the Public Debt, Currency, Receipts, and Expenditures of Liberia
(Name of country.)
Furnished by
[For the use of the Eleventh Census of the United States.]

div2.head: Liberia. Statement of Loans and Currency.

row.cell: Value in Coin of 100 in Current Money.
Issue Price per 100 in Current Money.
Present Market Value of 100 in Current Money.
Consolidation floating Domestic debt except Currency Demd: Notes
1890 But ever redeemable at three years from issue at pleasure of Government.
Legal Tender for all internal dues and for Customs in the proportion of 3/8 payment on Import dues & 9/10 for (on) Export dues

div2.p: Note–If any of the above loans are for use as a circulating medium, please state under "Remarks" for what purposes the same is a legal tender, and what provision, if any, has been made for its redemption.
(a) Date of end of fiscal year.

div2.head: Statement of Receipts, Expenditures, Interest Charge, etc.

row.cell: Net Receipts, Except from Loans. (Current Money.)
Net Expenditures, Except for Loans. (b) (Current money.)
Value in Coin of 100 in Current Money.
Cash or Sinking Fund on Hand.

div2.p: (b) Including interest on the public debt.
